discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Pretty straight forward on this on this one.

Selected Answer: A
Identifying staff with authority is part of incident management, but it's not the primary reason for declaring an incident. That step usually comes after the incident is reported.

Selected Answer: A
It is A

Selected Answer: B
Having the authority to declare the incident quickly is essential to launching a fast and coordinated response. Without a clear declaration process, valuable time is lost trying to determine who is in charge, which can allow a security threat to escalate.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the most important reason for an incident response team to develop a formal incident declaration?

choices.A: To require that an incident be reported through the proper channels
choices.D: To establish the department that responsible for responding to an incident
choices.C: To allow for public disclosure of a security event impacting the organization
choices.B: To identify and document staff who have the authority to decrease an incident

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C. Leverage an audit tool to identify changes that are being made.
This ensures that any changes made to the system are tracked, helping to identify what went wrong if something fails. It improves accountability and allows the team to trace back issues caused by recent changes.

D. Identify assets with dependence that could be impacted by the change.
This ensures that any changes made to one system donâ€™t negatively affect other systems or components. By understanding dependencies, the organization can better plan and minimize the risk of cascading failures.

Selected Answer: AD
Ensure recovery options for a botched upgrade, and get multiple eyes on systems downstream that could be impacted. Source - facilitated Change Management at several organizations

Selected Answer: AD
A) Ensure a document for system recovery is included. (This is already done in my organization, it is part of any CRQ we submit.) Back up has to be available incase the change fails, glitches, or have unexpected impacts.

D) Dependencies also has to be identified prior to performing the change. This needs to be completed so that system owners that might be impacted are informed, and they inform their users. We also do that.

C is compliance item like tripwire. It is not related to Change Requests.

I will vote A and D

choices.C: Leverage an audit tool to identify changes that are being made.
choices.A: Ensure users the document system recovery plan prior to deployment.
choices.F: Ensure that all assets are properly listed in the inventory management system.
choices.E: Require diagrams to be completed for all critical systems.
choices.D: Identify assets with dependence that could be impacted by the change.
choices.B: Perform a full system-level backup following the change.

questions.question_text: An organization has establish a formal change management process after experiencing several critical system failures over the past year. Which of the following are key factors that the change management process will include in order to reduce the impact of system failures? (Choose two.)

choices.A: The firewall service account was locked out.
choices.B: The firewall was using a paid feed.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This is such a stupid question. You can have several correct answers for this and none is more correct than the other.

Selected Answer: A
Firewall service account locked out (A):

 Many firewalls use service accounts to authenticate with external intelligence feeds. If this account is locked, the firewall would lose the ability to query or receive data from the feed. This is a common issue and is consistent with the scenario where only one specific feed is affected.

Selected Answer: A
Im picking A over C because if the firewall's certificate failed, such is the case in Answer C, then the question should've focused on the firewall as a whole having issues and not just its feed capability.

Selected Answer: A
If the firewall service account is locked out, the system would no longer be able to authenticate and fetch data, resulting in a disruption of the firewall feed. This is a common reason why specific data sources, such as firewall logs, may stop working while other feeds continue to operate normally. Dumb Question

Selected Answer: C
Im going with C.

Selected Answer: C
C. The firewall certificate expired.

Certificate expiration can disrupt communication and data exchange, including the ability to enrich data with external intelligence feeds.

questions.question_text: An analyst is suddenly unable to enrich data from the firewall. However, the other open intelligence feeds continue to work. Which of the following is the most likely reason in the firewall feed stopped working?

A security analyst would like to integrate two different SaaS-based security toots so that one tool can notify the other in the event a threat is detected. Which of the following should the analyst utilize to best accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. API endpoint

An API (Application Programming Interface) endpoint allows for direct communication and data exchange between two applications. By utilizing an API endpoint, the security analyst can:

Automate data sharing: Trigger actions in one tool based on events in the other.
Real-time notifications: Ensure timely alerts and incident response.
Customizable integrations: Tailor the integration to specific needs and requirements.

choices.B: Legal authorization was not obtained prior to seizing the evidence drive.
choices.C: Data integrity of the imaged drive could not be verified.
choices.A: Chain of custody was not maintained for the evidence drive.
choices.D: Evidence drive imaging was performed without a write blocker.

questions.question_text: An analyst is imaging a hard drive that was obtained from the system of an employee who is suspected of going rogue. The analyst notes that the initial hash of the evidence drive does not match the resultant hash of the imaged copy. Which of the following best describes the reason for the conflicting investigative findings?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
If a write blocker was not used, or if it was improperly configured, the original evidence drive may have been altered when connected for imaging.
